conclusion: Determine the ratio of magnitudes of acceleration for particles A and B during deceleration.
Particle A starts decelerating at t = t0 and comes to rest at t = 2t0. Particle B starts decelerating at t = 5t0 and comes to rest at t = 6t0.
Calculate deceleration for Particle A using a_A = Δv/Δt.
For Particle A, Δv_A = v0 and Δt_A = t0, so a_A = v0/t0.
Calculate deceleration for Particle B using a_B = Δv/Δt.
For Particle B, Δv_B = v0 and Δt_B = t0, so a_B = v0/t0.
Determine the ratio of magnitudes of deceleration: a_A/a_B = 1.
The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B during their deceleration phases is 1.
